case_vignette: A 52-year-old woman presents to the clinic with several days of vomiting and diarrhea. She also complains of headaches, muscle aches, and fever, but denies tenesmus, urgency, and bloody diarrhea. Past medical history is insignificant. When asked about any recent travel she says that she just came back from a cruise ship vacation. Her temperature is 37°C (98.6° F), respiratory rate is 15/min, pulse is 67/min, and blood pressure is 122/98 mm Hg. Physical examination is non-contributory. Microscopic examination of the stool is negative for ova or parasites.
question: What is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Infectious Diseases. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I've been experiencing vomiting, diarrhea, headaches, muscle aches, and fever for several days.
When did these symptoms start?
These symptoms started several days ago.
Have you recently traveled or eaten anything unusual?
Yes, I just came back from a cruise ship vacation.
Have any of your close contacts, such as family members or friends, shown similar symptoms?
The case vignette does not provide information regarding whether any close contacts have shown similar symptoms, so I cannot give an answer regarding that.
Understood. Have you been in contact with someone who was sick or noticed others on the cruise with similar symptoms?
The case vignette doesn't mention whether I have been in contact with someone sick or noticed others with similar symptoms.
Do you have any pre-existing medical conditions or are you on any chronic medications?
My past medical history is insignificant, so no pre-existing conditions or chronic medications.
Are you experiencing any abdominal pain or blood in your stools?
No, I'm not experiencing any abdominal pain or blood in my stools.
Do you have any known allergies, particularly to foods or medications?
The case vignette does not mention any allergies, so I have no known allergies to report.
Final Diagnosis: Norovirus infection (commonly acquired on cruise ships and characterized by vomiting, diarrhea, headaches, muscle aches, and fever).
